meanings.definition: A person who supports or advocates for government intervention or control.
meanings.sent1: The governmentalist believed in the power of the government to make positive changes in society.
meanings.sent2: As a governmentalist, she actively campaigned for increased government funding for education.
meanings.sent3: The governmentalist joked that their love for bureaucracy knew no bounds.
meanings.sent4: Her reputation as a governmentalist made her a sought-after speaker on political matters.
meanings.sent5: The passionate governmentalist inspired others to get involved in public policy.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a belief in the importance of government involvement in society.
meanings.sent1: The governmentalist policies aimed to strengthen the role of the government in social programs.
meanings.sent2: She had a governmentalist approach to addressing social inequalities.
meanings.sent3: The governmentalist perspective on governance was evident in their speeches.
meanings.sent4: His governmentalist views colored his approach to public policy decisions.
meanings.sent5: The governmentalist philosophy emphasized the need for government support in community development.
